HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You identify the following data loss prevention (DLP) requirements:
✑ Send notifications to users if they attempt to send attachments that contain an EU Social Security Number (SSN) or Equivalent ID.
✑ Prevent any email messages that contain credit card numbers from being sent outside your organization.
✑ Block the external sharing of Microsoft OneDrive content that contains EU passport numbers.
✑ Send administrators email alerts if any rule matches occur.
What is the minimum number of DLP policies and rules you must create to meet the requirements? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Policies are made up of one or more rules. Common protection requirements should be grouped in the same policy. Because different requirements must be met, a separate policy should be defined for each, Block, Notify users, Prevent. No separate rule or policy is needed for admin notification. I'll go with 3 and 3

3 policies and 3 rules is correct. You can't ignore Teams as this is location what you select when creating policy. Hypothetical user would be very upset if user would get notification when sending credit card details in Teams chat as attachment inside organization. According to requirement warning should only come if Social security number is attached in Teams chat or Exchange email. Conditions target 3 set of locations (1. Exchange + Teams 2. Exchange Only 3. One Drive)

DLP can be apply to the following locations: Exchange email, SharePoint sites, OneDrive Accounts, Teams chat and channel messages, Devices, Microsoft Defender for Cloud App, On-premises repositories and Power BI (preview) in one policy. 
I will say, 1 policy and 3 rules. Tested this in my lab.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
Some users access Microsoft SharePoint Online from unmanaged devices.
You create a conditional access policy in Azure Active Directory.
You need to prevent the users from downloading, printing, and syncing files.
What should you do?

choices.B: From the Microsoft Azure portal, create an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) conditional access policy.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Azure portal, create an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Identity Protection user risk policy.
choices.C: From the SharePoint admin center, configure the Access control settings.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Azure portal, create an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) Identity Protection sign-in risk policy.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant.
You have a database that stores customer details. Each customer has a unique 13-digit identifier that consists of a fixed pattern of numbers and letters.
You need to implement a data loss prevention (DLP) solution that meets the following requirements:
✑ Email messages that contain a single customer identifier can be sent outside your company.
✑ Email messages that contain two or more customer identifiers must be approved by the company's data privacy team.
Which two components should you include in the solution? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content:
he other options are incorrect.

Option A, Configure the permission level for OneDrive External sharing to be more restrictive, is incorrect because this would prevent users at Contoso from sharing files with users at Litware.
Option B, Modify the Device access settings, is incorrect because this setting is used to control which devices can access OneDrive. It does not affect the sharing of files with external users.
Option D, Change the permissions for OneDrive External sharing to the least permissive level, is incorrect because this would prevent users at Contoso from sharing files with any external users.
Option E, Modify the Sync settings, is incorrect because this setting is used to control how files are synced between OneDrive and your devices. It does not affect the sharing of files with external users.
Therefore, the correct answers are C and F.

Selected Answer: CF
The correct answers are C. Configure the permission level for OneDrive External sharing to be less restrictive and F. Modify the Links settings.

To allow users at Contoso to share files from Microsoft OneDrive to specific users at Litware, you need to configure the permission level for OneDrive External sharing to be less restrictive. This will allow users at Contoso to share files with users at Litware who are not in their organization.

You also need to modify the Links settings to allow users at Contoso to create links to shared files that can be accessed by users at Litware.

In summary, by configuring the permission level for OneDrive External sharing to be less restrictive and modifying the Links settings, users at Contoso can securely share files with specific users at Litware from Microsoft OneDrive.
